members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdate
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: columns
members.description: The nested columns in the group.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the group column is either manually specified, or the sum of the nested columns.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: filter
members.description: The filter function if you want to do custom filtering.

The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.

members.name: header

members.name: internalOptions
members.description: The internal options if none are provided.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: mode
members.description:
The mode for the filter:
- `select`: The filter will allow you to select from a list of options. If none
are provided, the filter will create a list of options based on the column's values
- `text`: The filter will be a text field.

members.name: options
members.description:
The options you can choose from to filter. If not provided,
the filter will be a text field.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: value
members.description: The value for this filter column.

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

members.name: activeItem
members.description: The active item in the grid.

members.name: activeItemChange
members.description: Emits when the active item changes

members.name: columns
members.description: The columns in the grid.

members.name: dataSource
members.description: Provide your own implementation for getting the data.

members.name: gridItemsChange
members.description: Emits when the items in the grid have changed.

members.name: gridStateChange
members.description: Emits when the state in the grid has changed.

members.name: itemParts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<tr>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: items
members.description: An array of items to be displayed in the grid.

members.name: noBorder
members.description: Hide the border around the grid when true.

members.name: noRowBorder
members.description: Hides the border between rows when true.

members.name: recalculateColumnWidths
members.description: Updates the `width` of all columns which have `autoWidth` set to `true`.

members.name: selection
members.description: Selection manager.

members.name: striped
members.description: Uses alternating background colors for the rows when set.

members.name: tbody
members.description: The `<tbody>` element.

members.name: thead
members.description: The `<thead>` element.

events.name: activeItemChange
events.description: Emits when the active item changes

events.name: gridItemsChange
events.description: Emits when the items in the grid have changed.

events.name: gridStateChange
events.description: Emits when the state in the grid has changed.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: An array of items to be displayed in the grid.

attributes.name: no-border
attributes.description: Hide the border around the grid when true.

attributes.name: no-row-border
attributes.description: Hides the border between rows when true.

attributes.name: striped
attributes.description: Uses alternating background colors for the rows when set.

methods.name: recalculateColumnWidths
methods.description: Updates the `width` of all columns which have `autoWidth` set to `true`.

attributes.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

events.name: columnUpdate
events.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

methods.name: stateChanged
methods.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

methods.name: itemsChanged
methods.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

fields.name: sorter
fields.description: If you want to provide a custom sort function, you can via this property.

fields.name: renderer
fields.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

fields.name: scopedElements
fields.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: column
members.description: The grid column.

members.name: direction
members.description: The direction in which to sort the items.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the field to sort on.

members.name: sortDirectionChange
members.description: Emits when the direction has changed.

members.name: sorter
members.description: An optional custom sort function.

members.name: sorterChange
members.description: Emits when the sorter has been added or removed.

events.name: sorterChange
events.description: Emits when the sorter has been added or removed.

events.name: sortDirectionChange
events.description: Emits when the direction has changed.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: The direction in which to sort the items.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path to the field to sort on.

members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdate
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
